NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"accrueInterest(address)":{"details":"Allows LiquidationEngine and keepers to force interest accrual      before health factor checks, ensuring debt is up-to-date.      Without this, a borrower could avoid liquidation by never      triggering _accrueInterest() (no borrow/repay interactions).","params":{"user":"The user whose interest to accrue"}},"borrow(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)"}},"borrowFor(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)","user":"The user to borrow for"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"healthFactor(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"Health factor in basis points (10000 = 1.0)"}},"healthFactorUnsafe(address)":{"details":"Used by LiquidationEngine so liquidations proceed during >20% price crashes.      Without this, healthFactor() reverts via getValueUsd() circuit breaker,      blocking all liquidations exactly when they are most needed.","returns":{"_0":"Health factor in basis points (10000 = 1.0)"}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"repay(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals)"}},"repayFor(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals)","user":"The user whose debt to repay"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw","token":"The collateral token"}}},"title":"BorrowModule","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"borrow(uint256)":{"notice":"Borrow mUSD against deposited collateral"},"borrowCapacity(address)":{"notice":"Get total borrow capacity for a user (public wrapper)"},"borrowFor(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Borrow mUSD on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)"},"getCurrentBorrowRate()":{"notice":"Get current annual borrow rate in BPS"},"getCurrentSupplyRate()":{"notice":"Get current annual supply rate in BPS"},"getTotalSupply()":{"notice":"Get total supply used for utilization calculation"},"getUtilizationRate()":{"notice":"Get current utilization rate in BPS"},"healthFactor(address)":{"notice":"Get health factor for a user (public view)"},"interestRateBps()":{"notice":"Fallback fixed rate if model not set (legacy compatibility)"},"interestRateModel()":{"notice":"Dynamic interest rate model (utilization-based)"},"lastGlobalAccrualTime()":{"notice":"Last time global interest was accrued"},"maxBorrow(address)":{"notice":"Get maximum additional borrow amount for a user"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause borrowing and repayments"},"protocolReserves()":{"notice":"Accumulated protocol reserves (from reserve factor)"},"reduceDebt(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Called by LiquidationEngine to reduce a user's debt after seizure"},"repay(uint256)":{"notice":"Repay mUSD debt"},"repayFor(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Repay mUSD debt on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)"},"setInterestRate(uint256)":{"notice":"Update the global interest rate Existing positions accrue at the OLD rate until their next interaction triggers _accrueInterest(). This is by-design (same as Aave/Compound variable rates) and avoids O(n) global accrual."},"setInterestRateModel(address)":{"notice":"Set the interest rate model (enables dynamic rates)"},"setSMUSD(address)":{"notice":"Set the SMUSD vault for interest routing"},"setTreasury(address)":{"notice":"Set the Treasury for supply calculation"},"smusd()":{"notice":"SMUSD vault to receive interest payments"},"totalBorrows()":{"notice":"Global total borrows across all users"},"totalDebt(address)":{"notice":"Get total debt (principal + accrued interest) for a user      matching _accrueInterest() execution. Previously used only pos.principal, causing      the view to understate pending interest vs what _accrueInterest actually charges."},"totalInterestPaidToSuppliers()":{"notice":"Total interest paid to suppliers (for analytics)"},"treasury()":{"notice":"Treasury for total supply calculation"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpause borrowing and repayments"},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraw collateral (only if position stays healthy)"},"withdrawReserves(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraw accumulated protocol reserves Instead of minting unbacked mUSD (which dilutes the peg), we try to mint within the supply cap. If the cap is hit, the withdrawal fails gracefully. Admin should coordinate with supply cap management before withdrawing."}},"notice":"Manages debt positions for overcollateralized mUSD borrowing.         Uses utilization-based dynamic interest rates (Compound-style).         Interest accrues per-second and is routed to SMUSD accrueInterest(address).details: Allows LiquidationEngine and keepers to force interest accrual      before health factor checks, ensuring debt is up-to-date.      Without this, a borrower could avoid liquidation by never      triggering _accrueInterest() (no borrow/repay interactions).

params.user: The user whose interest to accrue

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)
Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

healthFactorUnsafe(address).details: Used by LiquidationEngine so liquidations proceed during >20% price crashes.      Without this, healthFactor() reverts via getValueUsd() circuit breaker,      blocking all liquidations exactly when they are most needed.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals)
Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals)
params.user: The user whose debt to repay

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

borrowCapacity(address).notice: Get total borrow capacity for a user (public wrapper)

borrowFor(address,uint256).notice: Borrow mUSD on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

getCurrentBorrowRate().notice: Get current annual borrow rate in BPS

getCurrentSupplyRate().notice: Get current annual supply rate in BPS

getTotalSupply().notice: Get total supply used for utilization calculation

getUtilizationRate().notice: Get current utilization rate in BPS

healthFactor(address).notice: Get health factor for a user (public view)

interestRateBps().notice: Fallback fixed rate if model not set (legacy compatibility)

lastGlobalAccrualTime().notice: Last time global interest was accrued

maxBorrow(address).notice: Get maximum additional borrow amount for a user

reduceDebt(address,uint256).notice: Called by LiquidationEngine to reduce a user's debt after seizure

repayFor(address,uint256).notice: Repay mUSD debt on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

setInterestRate(uint256).notice: Update the global interest rate Existing positions accrue at the OLD rate until their next interaction triggers _accrueInterest(). This is by-design (same as Aave/Compound variable rates) and avoids O(n) global accrual.

setInterestRateModel(address).notice: Set the interest rate model (enables dynamic rates)

setSMUSD(address).notice: Set the SMUSD vault for interest routing

setTreasury(address).notice: Set the Treasury for supply calculation

smusd().notice: SMUSD vault to receive interest payments

totalBorrows().notice: Global total borrows across all users

totalDebt(address).notice: Get total debt (principal + accrued interest) for a user      matching _accrueInterest() execution. Previously used only pos.principal, causing      the view to understate pending interest vs what _accrueInterest actually charges.

totalInterestPaidToSuppliers().notice: Total interest paid to suppliers (for analytics)

withdrawCollateral(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw collateral (only if position stays healthy)

withdrawReserves(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw accumulated protocol reserves Instead of minting unbacked mUSD (which dilutes the peg), we try to mint within the supply cap. If the cap is hit, the withdrawal fails gracefully. Admin should coordinate with supply cap management before withdrawing.
